level.heading: Rules and regulations governing respite care.

level.text: The Department on Disability Services shall promulgate rules and regulations governing the provision of respite care for persons with intellectual disabilities. These shall provide that periods of respite care shall not exceed 42 days in a 12-month period without specific authorization by the Court after a hearing conducted in accordance with subchapter IV of this chapter.

Should any person be detained for respite care for a period exceeding 42 days in a 12-month period without specific authorization by the Court after a hearing conducted in accordance with subchapter IV of this chapter, he or she shall be promptly discharged.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 16-264, in subsec. (a), substituted "Department on Disability Services" for "Department of Human Services".
D.C. Law 16-305, in subsec. (a), substituted "persons with mental retardation" for "mentally retarded persons".
D.C. Law 19-169 substituted "an intellectual disabilities" for "mental retardation".

level.heading: Emergency Act Amendments
level.text: For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 301(h) of Developmental Disabilities Services Management Reform Emergency Amendment Act of 2006 (D.C. Act 16-672, December 28, 2006, 54 DCR 1155).
